intro: Hieracium xanthostylomorphum, commonly known as the yellow-styled hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 centimeters, with bright yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed sites.
